course.name: Ethics and Public Affairs
course.description: This course studies the ethical dimensions of public affairs. The overarching theme is to explore the moral debate surrounding some pressing public issues in todayâ€™s world. The first part introduces the essential moral concepts and theories for reasoning in ethics and public affairs. The second part discusses a selection of disputed public issues through the application of moral concepts and theories. By the end of the course, students will benefit with the knowledge and skills necessary for discussing public affairs from the perspective of ethics.
